TopicTitle: [0.21.x] Kerbal Crew Manifest v0.5.5.0 Released! 0.21 Compatible!!!

Articles.Content:
Put the CrewManifest directory (and everything under it) in the GameData directory, *not* the Plugins directory:

Kerbal Space Program/

-GameData/

--CrewManifest/

---Plugins/

----CrewManifest.dll

----PluginData/

-----CrewManifest/

------config.exml

------IconOff.png

------IconOn.png

--Squad

Note this contradicts the installation instructions. Don't know what the deal is, but this works for me and installing per the instructions does not.

(Spot on, and very nicely explained)

The "deal" is that the generic instructions on the SpacePort are for KSP verisons up to 0.19. From v0.20 onwards the places to put files have changed to the format you described, but, as of now, the SpacePort hasn't updated it's instructions.

Put the CrewManifest directory (and everything under it) in the GameData directory, *not* the Plugins directory:

Kerbal Space Program/

-GameData/

--CrewManifest/

---Plugins/

----CrewManifest.dll

----PluginData/

-----CrewManifest/

------config.exml

------IconOff.png

------IconOn.png

--Squad

Note this contradicts the installation instructions. Don't know what the deal is, but this works for me and installing per the instructions does not.

thanks for the suggestion but thats how i had it installed

I don't think I have installed crew manifest correctly.

I copied the dll file into the plugin subdirectory and the plugin data into the plugin data subdirectory, but nothing is happening.

I get one button in the space center and that is a question mark in a box.

Are there supposed to be parts? There weren't any in the zip file.

Am I supposed to edit the cfg files for all the parts?

I don't think I have installed crew manifest correctly.

I copied the dll file into the plugin subdirectory and the plugin data into the plugin data subdirectory, but nothing is happening.

I get one button in the space center and that is a question mark in a box.

Are there supposed to be parts? There weren't any in the zip file.

Am I supposed to edit the cfg files for all the parts?

See posts above you. Long story is that the install instructions on Spaceport are for KSP 0.19 and are now outdated, now you simply put all those files into the Gamedata subdirectory, not the plugin subdirectory. And no the mod doesn't come with any parts to attach to your craft or any config edits, it just comes working right out of the GameData subdirectory.

See posts above you. Long story is that the install instructions on Spaceport are for KSP 0.19 and are now outdated, now you simply put all those files into the Gamedata subdirectory, not the plugin subdirectory. And no the mod doesn't come with any parts to attach to your craft or any config edits, it just comes working right out of the GameData subdirectory.

I have reinstalled exactly as shown above and I am still not getting the button.

I am using Version 0.21 on Windows 7.

I have reinstalled exactly as shown above and I am still not getting the button.

I am using Version 0.21 on Windows 7.

!!!!Finally found the problem!!!!

Apparently you have to run KSP as administrator.

If you just run it normally it won't load Kerbal Crew Manifest.

Windows 7 has a real bug about that.

You can spend ages trying to find out why something doesn't work the way it should, only to find out that you only had to run the program as administrator and it will work fine.

!!!!Finally found the problem!!!!

Apparently you have to run KSP as administrator.

If you just run it normally it won't load Kerbal Crew Manifest.

Windows 7 has a real bug about that.

You can spend ages trying to find out why something doesn't work the way it should, only to find out that you only had to run the program as administrator and it will work fine.

Interesting. It's probably an issue with folder permissions then. I hate permission issues >.<

I'm working on adding the roster to the astronaut complex. I have it working, but I can't get the changes to update in the Astronaut Complex GUI. I'll continue to look into it. Hopefully I can get it working.
Glad to hear you're still working on it, Sovereign--this mod used to be a requirement like MechJeb for me, though with the new Astronaut Complex, it is still useful for IVA/Crew Transfers.
Put the created kerbals in the list of applicants?
I wonder if anyone else has created a Major Tom Kermin, or if I'm the first/only one?
Nope. I've got a little list of Kerbals with famous astronaut nicknames: Hoot, Deke, Buzz, Gus, Freddo, Rusty, and Major Tom.
My next thought was Ziggy Stardust
He was a guitar player, not an astronaut.
Well, okay then. How about Major Anthony Nelson?

Question, do you need to a module to part's .ctg files before this will work? Just wondering before I get to deep into it

Edited August 12, 2013 by Rassa Farlander
spelling
There is no extra parts needed or messing with part configs, once you install the mod you will always have the crew transfer interface.
Ok thanks I was wondering about that, KOSMOS mod has crew manifest modules in it part .ctg for some reason
Versions before 0.5 used to require a part with the module. It's completely stand alone now.

Hi, I have KSP v0.20.2. I dowloaded the latest version of this mod, the icons show up on my space center screen; however, it doesn't show in the launch pad screen. Please if anyone has a solution I would greatly appreciate it.

Hi, I have KSP v0.20.2. I dowloaded the latest version of this mod, the icons show up on my space center screen; however, it doesn't show in the launch pad screen. Please if anyone has a solution I would greatly appreciate it.

It's probably hidden behind other UI elements. Try moving it to the right.

The latest version of the mod only supports KSP v0.21 since I had to change the code to work with the new crew management objects. I'll give you a link to an older version of the mod when I can get back to my computer.

I found the link. Use this version of the mod for KSP 0.20.

Manifest for versions before 0.21
